member.summary: Send the command to stop the calibration mode

member.summary: Picks another image from the device album to replace the previous one and send to the glass initializing another debuging process

member.name: M:DoradSmartphone.ViewModels.CalibrationViewModel.SendImage(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Receive the new image, check the Bluetooth connection, if it's connected, it prepare the Command DTO with the start debug command and send it over Bluetooth. If there's no connection take the user back to the GlassPage

member.summary: Verify the status of the connection as sonn as the app starts.

member.name: M:DoradSmartphone.ViewModels.GlassViewModel.Calibration
member.summary: Check the connection status if its's connected, it picks a photo from the smartphone album, add into the commandDTO with the start debug command, send over bluetooth and go to the Calibration Page. If it's not connected then just fire a Toast message

member.summary: Receive the command DTO, send it to the method ConvertToJsonAndBytes, and send the result over bluetooth.

member.name: M:CalculateWidgetPositions.LoadAutomaticPage(DoradSmartphone.DTO.TransferDTO,Microsoft.Maui.Controls.ContentPage@)
member.summary: Receives the TransferDTO (Could it be only the Widget entity?!) and the ContentPage (Automatic or Manual Pages) then iterates through the widgets to calculate their position in the screen.

member.name: M:CalculateWidgetPositions.CalculateRelativePositions(System.Collections.Generic.List{DoradSmartphone.Models.Widget})
member.summary: Calculate the relative positions of the widgets. The Calculation is based on cartesian plan (X and Y axis) divided by the screen size and multiply per 100

member.name: M:CalculateWidgetPositions.CalculateGlassesPositions(System.Collections.Generic.List{DoradSmartphone.Models.Widget})
member.summary: Calculate the glass position based in the relative position in the smartphone device. Taking in mind that Unity position metrics works differently from the cartesian plan, where the 0,0 position is in the middle of the screen

member.name: M:CalculateWidgetPositions.FormatPositions(System.Collections.Generic.List{DoradSmartphone.Models.Widget})
member.summary: Here we just format to double with two digits

member.name: M:CalculateWidgetPositions.GetScreenResolution
member.summary: Method to get the screen resolution of the actual device, returns a Tuple of integer in which are the heigh and width of the pixel resolution

member.name: M:GoogleMapsGeocoding.GetAddressName(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Receives the latitude and longitude, then go to the google maps api in the internet to grab the full address based on the provided coordinates. We use to get the starting and finishing address of the routes. It will return the image of the map later.

member.name: M:GoogleMapsGeocoding.GetPlacePhotoUrl(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Receive the coordinates and uses google maps api to get a static image of the google maps location.

member.name: T:GoogleMapsGeocodingResponse
member.summary: Class to handle the google maps api response

member.name: T:GoogleMapsGeocodingResult
member.summary: Class to handle with the result, in our case only the address
